item.title: How To Read A Rate Sheet Without A Finance Degree
item.description: Rate sheets intimidate most borrowers because they look like spreadsheets designed for loan officers, not humans. Rows of basis points, adjustment grids, and cryptic footnotes make it nearly impossible to compare one lender against another. US Mortgage Specialist translates rate sheets into a format you can actually use, but understanding the basics yourself gives you negotiating power and helps you spot when a lender is hiding costs. Here is how to decode the most important pieces without needing a finance degree.
